item.title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons Switch 2 Edition Is Nintendo's Cheapest Paid Upgrade Yet
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While a few first-party Nintendo Switch 2 games have invoked sticker shock, that won't be the case with Animal Crossing: New Horizons. Once the Switch 2 edition of the life sim releases on January 15, it'll be the least expensive paid upgrade from Nintendo.

Existing owners of New Horizons only have to cough up $5 for the upgrade pack, while the entire Switch 2 edition retails for $65 digitally and physically.

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Animal Crossing: New Horizons â€“ 3.0 Update and Switch 2 Edition Overview Trailer

That's significantly lower than Nintendo's other Switch 2 editions; upgrades for The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and its sequel Tears of the Kingdom, along with Kirby and the Forgotten Land and Super Mario Party Jamboree cost $20.

On the lower end, Pokemon Legends: Z-A and Metroid Prime 4: Beyond charge $10 for their respective Switch 2 upgrades. And of course, Nintendo offers several free non-Switch 2 Edition updates for games like Super Mario Odyssey and Pokemon Scarlet and Violet.

Features exclusive to the Switch 2 edition of New Horizons include improved resolution that reaches 4K on TV mode, mouse controls, microphone and camera functionality, and support for 12-player online sessions.

Additionally, New Horizons is also getting a free update that adds some noteworthy features for both the Switch 1 and Switch 2 versions. The marquee experience is the resort hotel that you'll run with Kapp'n's family, which lets you decorate guest rooms. You'll also be able to upgrade your home storage and design dream islands with your friends online.

Of course, you can experience those new features regardless of whether or not you buy the Switch 2 upgrade. But even if you're still unwilling to pay $5 for the Switch 2 upgrade, you'll see some improvements for New Horizons when the update launches.

According to Nintendo's official website, the game will have visuals that are "optimized for the Nintendo Switch 2 display and improved image quality" through a free update. Just be sure to be totally ready for the update by transferring your island from your original Switch to the Switch 2.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Arc Raiders Prescriptions Of The Past Quest Guide
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've been working through Lance's quests in Arc Raiders, you've probably come across Prescriptions of the Past, wherein this quirky trader sends you off to round up anything useful in the Medical Exam Room of the Departure Building. And with that, you'll be off to Spaceport.

Extracting isn't a requirement for completing Prescriptions of the Past, but it is a high-traffic area. If you're a pretty peaceful player, you may want to bring in a free loadout so you don't sacrifice good loot if someone picks a fight you're not interested in entertaining. Alternatively, if you're feeling froggy, bring some good guns and plenty of ammo to introduce to any PVPers in the vicinity.

Either way, when you're ready to wrap up Prescriptions of the Past, follow the guide below.

Visit the Departure Building in Spaceport

The Departure Building is located on the west side of Spaceport. This POI is known to contain a lot of searchable drawers and containers, making it a popular destination for raiders seeking a high chance at good loot. With that in mind, keep your eyes peeled for any shady characters looming about with their guns out.

For the most straightforward approach, head into the Departure Building from the north through the main entrance.

When you enter the building, you should receive an updated objective asking you to find the Medical Exam Room.

Find the Medical Exam Room inside the Departure Building

Once you're inside the Departure Building, head up the stairs to the right.

Follow this staircase to the right to reach the next floor.

At the top of the stairs, break left immediately, then enter the nearby door on the left. This is the Medical Exam Room.

You should now be prompted to search for some records.

Search for the records

Once you're in the Medical Exam Room, walk forward past the examination tables until you reach a desk containing some papers.

Interact with these papers to knock out the last part of the quest. With that done, you're now free to extract. However, since the Departure Building is such a high-quality spot for loot, we'd recommend you stick around and sift through all the drawers and such across both floors of the building--provided another raider hasn't already beat you to it.

For more, check out our full Arc Raiders quest list, or take a look over the comprehensive Arc Raiders guides hub.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The Sims 4 Next Collab Is Seriously Bougie, But Will Cost You Nothing
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Sims is no stranger to collaborating with major fashion brands. Back in 2007, developer Maxis partnered up with H&M to bring dozens of real-life clothing items to The Sims 2. In more recent years, both Primark and Moschino have made their way into the series with The Sims 4 Stuff Packs. Now, the American brand Coach is headed to the game in the series' most luxurious collab yet.

Starting on January 13, The Sims 4 players will gain access to The Coach Collection, a catalog of nine new items inspired by the "wearable staples" and "bold statement pieces" Coach is known for. The Create-A-Sim items coming include the company's Soho sneakers, a varsity jacket, and sleek skirt sets, while Build Mode will receive the heritage trunk and both Tabby and Brooklyn purses.

In addition to these items, The Coach Collection comes with a new family available to move in via The Sims Gallery: The Carriage House. The press release described the family as "three friends chasing big dreams, big style, and a little bit of drama." The gallery will also feature a new room to place named the "In The Bag room," which appears to be a large walk-in closet that will allow Sims to show off their luxury handbags in style.

In other The Sims news, developer Maxis recently released a statement assuring players that its "values are unchanged" following news that parent company EA is looking to sell itself to the Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund. The team also reiterated that it is committed to creating "single-player life simulation experiences" while also teasing upcoming The Sims experiences for PC, consoles, and mobile.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
